Response V1 List Models By Provider

get.description: Get a provider endpoint by name.

put.description: Update a provider endpoint by name.

get.description:
List all workspaces.

Args:
    provider_name (Optional[str]): Filter workspaces by provider name. If provided,
    will return workspaces where models from the specified provider (e.g., OpenAI,
    Anthropic) have been used in workspace muxing rules.

Returns:
    ListWorkspacesResponse: A response object containing the list of workspaces.

List all active workspaces.

In it's current form, this function will only return one workspace. That is,
the globally active workspace.

post.description: Recover an archived workspace by name.

delete.description: Hard delete an archived workspace by name.

get.description: Get alert summary for a workspace.
Get the custom instructions of a workspace.

Get the mux rules of a workspace.

The list is ordered in order of priority. That is, the first rule in the list
has the highest priority.

put.description: Set the mux rules of a workspace.

get.description: Get the token usage of a workspace.

AddProviderEndpointRequest.title: AddProviderEndpointRequest
AddProviderEndpointRequest.description: Represents a request to add a provider endpoint.

AlertConversation.title: AlertConversation
AlertConversation.description: Represents an alert with it's respective conversation.

AlertSummary.title: AlertSummary
AlertSummary.description: Represents a set of summary alerts

CodeSnippet.title: CodeSnippet
CodeSnippet.description:
Represents a code snippet with its programming language.

Args:
    language: The programming language identifier (e.g., 'python', 'javascript')
    code: The actual code content

ConfigureAuthMaterial.title: ConfigureAuthMaterial
ConfigureAuthMaterial.description: Represents a request to configure auth material for a provider.

ModelByProvider.title: ModelByProvider
ModelByProvider.description:
Represents a model supported by a provider.

Note that these are auto-discovered by the provider.

MuxMatcherType.title: MuxMatcherType
MuxMatcherType.description:
Represents the different types of matchers we support.

The 3 rules present match filenames and request types. They're used in conjunction with the
matcher field in the MuxRule model.
E.g.
- catch_all-> Always match
- filename_match and match: requests.py -> Match the request if the filename is requests.py
- fim_filename and match: main.py -> Match the request if the request type is fim
and the filename is main.py

NOTE: Removing or updating fields from this enum will require a migration.
Adding new fields is safe.

MuxRule.title: MuxRule
MuxRule.description: Represents a mux rule for a provider.

PersonaRequest.title: PersonaRequest
PersonaRequest.description: Model for creating a new Persona.

ProviderAuthType.title: ProviderAuthType
ProviderAuthType.description: Represents the different types of auth we support for providers.

ProviderEndpoint.title: ProviderEndpoint
ProviderEndpoint.description:
Represents a provider's endpoint configuration. This
allows us to persist the configuration for each provider,
so we can use this for muxing messages.

ProviderType.title: ProviderType
ProviderType.description: Represents the different types of providers we support.

QuestionAnswer.title: QuestionAnswer
QuestionAnswer.description: Represents a question and answer pair.

TokenUsage.title: TokenUsage
TokenUsage.description:
TokenUsage it's not a table, it's a model to represent the token usage.
The data is stored in the outputs table.

TokenUsageAggregate.title: TokenUsageAggregate
TokenUsageAggregate.description:
Represents the tokens used. Includes the information of the tokens used by model.
`used_tokens` are the total tokens used in the `tokens_by_model` list.

TokenUsageByModel.title: TokenUsageByModel
TokenUsageByModel.description: Represents the tokens used by a model.
